translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Questions of the Youth Hemaka
“Those who in the past explained to me
(thus said the venerable Hemaka)

analyzed: huram gotamasāsanā  id ca asi iti bhavissati
translated: The Dhamma of the Gotama’s teaching;🔽‘It is so’ and ‘It will be so’,

analyzed: sabbam tam iti hi iti ha
translated: All that is ‘It was so’ and ‘It is so’;
All that is just an increase in thought,
I do not delight in that at all.
You should explain the Dhamma to me,
the sage who has destroyed craving;
Having understood that, living mindfully,
one crosses over the flood in the world”.
“In regard to what is seen, heard, sensed, or cognized,
In regard to what is dear, Hemaka;
The removal of desire and passion,
The state of Nibbāna, the Deathless.
Those who, knowing this, are mindful,
who are emancipated in this very life;
And they are always peaceful,
they have crossed over the flood in the world”.
The Questions of the Youth Hemaka, the eighth.
